document.docAuthor: Silva, Fabio Laurindo Da, Fonseca-Gessner, Alaide Aparecida & Ekrem, Torbjørn
document.docTitle: Labrundinia Silva, Fonseca-Gessner & Ekrem, 2014, sp. n.
document.masterDocTitle: A taxonomic revision of genus Labrundinia Fittkau, 1962 (Diptera: Chironomidae: Tanypodinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A taxonomic revision of genus Labrundinia Fittkau, 1962 (Diptera: Chironomidae: Tanypodinae)

heading.emphasis:
Key to the larvae of
Labrundinia

subSubSection.paragraph:
The larvae of
Labrundinia amazonica
sp. n.
,
L. costaricae
sp. n.
,
L. fera
,
L. fosteri
,
L. hirsuta
,
L. kogilamae
sp. n.
,
L. meta
,
L. nathani
sp. n.
,
L. nicaraguensis
sp. n.
,
L. opela
,
L. parabecki
,
L. panamensis
sp. n.
,
L. setosa
sp. n.
and
L. trilucida
sp. n.
remain unknown.

paragraph.keyLead:
2 . Head with one or more lateroventral spine (
Figs 69 A
; 33 A)................................................... 3

3 . Lateroventral spine group consisting of only a single, enlarged spur (
Fig. 69 A
)...............
Labrundinia robacki
sp. n.

4 . Subbasal setae of posterior parapods serrated basally (
Fig. 33 H
); bifid claw with U-shaped lower indentation (
Fig.
33 I
).......................................................................................
Labrundinia longipalpis

5 . Head with dark brown posteroventral spot (
Fig. 51 A
)................................
Labrundinia parafittkaui
sp. n.

6 . Head slender almost rectangular; IC 0.51 (
Fig. 22 A
)......................................
Labrundinia gregi
sp. n.

- Head not as above, broader; IC 0.57–0.60 (
Fig. 18 A
)....................................
Labrundinia fittkaui
sp. n.
- Claw of posterior parapods with smooth inner margin...................................................... 11

8 . Bifid claws of posterior parapods with U-shaped lower indentation (
Fig. 81 J
).....................
Labrundinia tenata

9 . Subbasal setae of posterior parapods serrated basally (
Fig.
40 I
)........................
Labrundinia multidentata
sp. n.

– Subbasal setae of posterior parapods simple (
Figs
54 I
,
66 I
).................................................. 10

10 . Head with posteroventral spine group (
Fig. 54 A
).................................
Labrundinia parareniformis
sp. n.

- Head without posteroventral spine group (
Fig. 66 A
)...................................
Labrundinia reniformis
sp. n.

keyStep.keyLead:
12 . Ventral maculation on head semicircular (
Fig. 71 B
); bifid claws of posterior parapod with U-shaped lower indentation.................................................................................
Labrundinia semicurvata
sp. n.

subSubSection.paragraph:
(
Fig.
15 I
)......................................................................
Labrundinia fiorelinii
sp. n.
13 . Ratio between inner tooth length and outer tooth length on bifid claw (B/C) 1.09–1.22 ; posterior margin may be darkened (
Fig. 63
)................................................................................ Labrundiniapilosella

paragraph.keyLead: - Ratio between inner tooth length and outer tooth length on bifid claw (B/C) 0.89–0.97 ............................. 14

14 . Head entirely yellow, without any maculation (
Fig. 74 A
)....................................
Labrundinia separata

- Head dark along postoccipital margin (
Fig. 78 A
)........................................
Labrundinia sofiae
sp. n.

16 . Head with lateroventral spine group consisting of only a single, enlarged spur (
Fig. 60 A
)........
Labrundinia paulae
sp. n.

18 . Ventral maculation on head distinct (
Fig. 29 A
)...........................................
Labrundinia johannseni

19 . Posterior parapod with simple subbasal seta (
Fig. 7 H
); bifid claw with V-shaped lower indentation (
Fig.
7 I
)....................................................................................................
Labrundinia becki

21 . Head with lateroventral spine group consisting of large spines (
Fig. 88 A
).......................
Labrundinia virescens

- Ligula 88–89 Μm long (
Fig. 57 F
)...............................................
Labrundinia paravirescens
sp. n.

25 . Head yellow with small, dark brown ventral spots (
Fig. 3 A
)............................
Labrundinia amandae
sp. n.

- Head yellow without any spots (
Fig. 85 A
)...........................................
Labrundinia unicolor
sp. n.
